intro: Gilibertia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gilibertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, often as a perennial herb. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can remain viable in the soil for several years. Gilibertia cuneifolia is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
